overview: Filmed at the Montreal Jazz Festival in the early 1980s, this concert provides nearly an hour of first-class jazz. Bob Mintzer is outspoken on tenor sax in the opening number, underpinned by Jacos clear and propulsive bass. Othello Molineaux coaxes a wide range of sounds out of a single steel drum  possibly the most awkward musical instrument ever devised by man  but Othello makes it sing radiantly.
title: Jaco Pastorius: Live in Montreal
